definition: my unworthy opinion (humble expr.)
awkward/clumsy/dull/inelegant/(polite) my/Taiwan pr. [zhuo2]
to appear/also written 現|现[xian4]
to see/to meet/to appear (to be sth)/to interview

sentences.english: Which looks kinda cool in my humble opinion.
sentences.chinese: 依我拙見，這看起來有一些酷。

sentences.english: Due to the circumstance, writer announce opinion by myself.
sentences.chinese: 針對這種情況筆者發表了拙見。

sentences.english: At last, I give some advice on China's securities regulatory issues.
sentences.chinese: 文章最後還對我國的證券監管問題提出了一點拙見。

sentences.english: It is simply mind boggling to contemplate the future of education on the internet.
sentences.chinese: 這只是我對未來互聯網教育的拙見。

definition: lit. draw legs on a snake (idiom); fig. to ruin the effect by adding sth superfluous/to overdo it
lit. one body two sides (idiom)/fig. a situation with two sides to it
(humble expr.) of humble talent and shallow learning (idiom); Pray forgive my ignorance,...
stupid/slow-witted
words do not convey the meaning/poorly expressed/senseless/inarticulate
subject
sequel/continuation of a book
lit. to build a cart behind closed doors/to be overly subjective and disregard the outside world (idiom)
lit. trifling destroys the will (idiom); infatuation with fine details prevents one making progress/excessive attention to trivia saps the will
lit. to scratch the outside of the boot (idiom)/fig. beside the point/ineffectual
to comprehend (new things) by analogy
to guide patiently and systematically (idiom)
to force someone to do something
shallow opinion/humble opinion
Ma Sanli (1914-2003), Chinese comedian
to put on an attitude/to pose
